verses.text: But Job answered and said ,
Hear diligently my speech , and let this be your consolations.
Suffer me that I may speak ; and after that I have spoken , mock on.
As for me, \add is\add* my complaint to man ? and if \add it were so\add*, why should not my spirit be troubled ?\f + \fr 21.4 \ft troubled: Heb. shortened?\f*
Mark me, and be astonished , and lay \add your\add* hand upon \add your\add* mouth.\f + \fr 21.5 \ft Mark…: Heb. Look unto me\f*
Even when I remember I am afraid , and trembling taketh hold on my flesh. \p
Wherefore do the wicked live , become old , yea, are mighty in power ?
Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.
Their houses \add are\add* safe from fear , neither \add is\add* the rod of God upon them.\f + \fr 21.9 \ft safe…: Heb. peace from\f*
Their bull gendereth , and faileth not; their cow calveth , and casteth not her calf.
They send forth their little ones like a flock , and their children dance.
They take the timbrel and harp , and rejoice at the sound of the organ.
They spend their days in wealth , and in a moment go down to the grave.\f + \fr 21.13 \ft in wealth: or, in mirth\f*
Therefore they say unto God , Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.
What \add is\add* the Almighty , that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?
Lo, their good \add is\add* not in their hand : the counsel of the wicked is far from me. \p
How oft is the candle of the wicked put out ! and \add how oft\add* cometh their destruction upon them! \add God\add* distributeth sorrows in his anger.\f + \fr 21.17 \ft candle: or, lamp\f*
They are as stubble before the wind , and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.\f + \fr 21.18 \ft carrieth: Heb. stealeth\f*
God layeth up his iniquity for his children : he rewardeth him, and he shall know \add it\add*.\f + \fr 21.19 \ft his iniquity: that is, the punishment of his iniquity\f*
His eyes shall see his destruction , and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
For what pleasure \add hath\add* he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst ?
Shall \add any\add* teach God knowledge ? seeing he judgeth those that are high.
One dieth in his full strength , being wholly at ease and quiet.\f + \fr 21.23 \ft his…: Heb. his very, or, the strength of, his perfection\f*
His breasts are full of milk , and his bones are moistened with marrow.\f + \fr 21.24 \ft breasts: or, milk pails\f*
And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul , and never eateth with pleasure.
They shall lie down alike in the dust , and the worms shall cover them. \p
Behold, I know your thoughts , and the devices \add which\add* ye wrongfully imagine against me.
For ye say , Where \add is\add* the house of the prince ? and where \add are\add* the dwelling places of the wicked ?\f + \fr 21.28 \ft the dwelling…: Heb. the tent of the tabernacles\f*
Have ye not asked them that go by the way ? and do ye not know their tokens ,
That the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction ? they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.\f + \fr 21.30 \ft wrath: Heb. wraths\f*
Who shall declare his way to his face ? and who shall repay him \add what\add* he hath done ?
Yet shall he be brought to the grave , and shall remain in the tomb.\f + \fr 21.32 \ft grave: Heb. graves\f*\f + \fr 21.32 \ft remain…: Heb. watch in the heap\f*
The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as \add there are\add* innumerable before him.
How then comfort ye me in vain , seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood ?\f + \fr 21.34 \ft falsehood: Heb. transgression?\f*
